h2. Experiment setup:

In all the experiments with results described below, the setup used was the 
following:

<pre>
RO                 = 200
TB                 = 350
IP                 = -0.0
SFZ                = 22.0
SFB                = 15.0
SFT                = 15.0
</pre>

h2. MK &ndash; Vystadial-3 wit

*Experimenter*: MK
*Data*: Vystadial
*Number of test sentences*: 774 (dunno why not 773, the expected number)
*CROSS setting*: wit (word-internal combinations only)
*Note*: This experiment is an improvement over Vystadial-1 in that a bug in the training scripts that caused old models to be overwritten by models trained in a new iteration. Apart from that, the model exported is now indeed the highest-order trigram model, not the one preceding it (which was never evaluated).
*Note*: As part of fixing bugs, I updated the "# GMMs" value for the models. They are the same models, but I think the value greater by two is the correct one.
*Note*: Although the acoustic model is now better on itself (zerograms), when combined with the language model, it does not achieve the quality of Vystadial-1 (or Vystadial-2, which is the same model). Hence, I don't put this model to the repo as the new acoustic model.
